title: The wicked mans plot defeated, or, The wicked man laughed out of countenance as it was represented in a sermon preached in St. Mary Wool-Church, London, May 11, 1656, by Thomas Baker.
author: Baker, Thomas, Rector of St. Mary the More.
notes: With: Gods provenance asserted in another sermon preached at St. Buttolphs, Aldersgate, London : near about the same time as the former / and by the same authour. Christs coming to judgement deciphered in a third sermon preached at Lincolnes-Inn / by the same author.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
